Params: He runs for his life through the dark underground factory, a shower of bullets and lasers strike from behind, sparks flying from the metal racks they hit.

The safety door had long been shut when the alarm was first triggered. He could only keep dodging behind the huge machine tool and storage shelves. As he turns the corner, a laser beam catches his left arm, sending up a wave of excruciating pain.
At the same time, he slides into an inconspicuous air duct and crawls to the other side of the room.

He will have to come up with another excuse. Murray seems to have noticed something recently and looked like he had something to say to Lee. Murray's situation is also worsening again, he cannot make him worry anymore—
Where'd that bastard go?! Find him!
...Now's not the time to think, I need to focus on getting out of this place.
Relax, there's no way out for him here. He's probably cowering in fear already. Let's have a bit of fun with him before Boss comes.
Never thought someone would be so brave to come stealing alone.
One... Two... Three... So I got four shots left.
Lee wipes away the blood stains outside the air duct. With a roll of gauze in his teeth, he bandages his wounded arm and starts counting his ammunition in a corner of the room.
Lee, do you copy? What's your situation?
Hearing his teammate's voice from his tiny terminal, Lee lowers his voice to reply.
I have the target, currently evacuating the site.
Your cover is not blown, is it?
I was. Our intel was wrong, there were four security keys to their security system.
Cracking that took up some extra time, your pre-set surveillance interference ended up three seconds short.
...Well, as long as you got the goods. Do they know our plan?
Good, I'll meet you at our rendezvous point.
The communication is swiftly cut off by the other side.
There are two guards inside the factory and at least six outside... I need a plan.
He surveys his dimly lit surroundings. The room he is in appears to be a mechanical warehouse filled with failed experimental objects and defective parts.
And he found what he needed in this heap of junk.
He's hurt so he won't be able to run far.
Over there! He went to the right!
That's strange... I swear I saw someone here...
A black shadow bursts out from the racks and hides behind the cargo in the corner. A sticky substance drips onto the floor with its movements.
Seriously? I expected better. He probably can't move much with such a serious wound.
They laugh manically as they fire two shots into the corner.
Make sure he's still alive for questioning.
They approach the corner, only to find that what lay in the pile of cargo is not the wounded intruder they expected, but a broken humanoid machine.
****, that wasn't a human we saw!
It's a defect from the warehouse! Impossible, why was it moving?!
Wait, where'd the bastard go then?!
In the end, the two guards never saw how the figure manifested from the darkness behind them, nor how quickly he slit their throats.
Lee sheathes his blade back into his belt, freely letting the two lifeless bodies slide down to the ground. He fishes out a key card and leaves without a second glance.
What awaited him at the rendezvous point was not an aiding teammate, but the cold barrel of a gun pointing at his forehead.
Put down your weapon and give me the goods. No funny business!
Lee takes out an object from his pocket—a storage device in the shape of a stick.
Satisfied, he inconspicuously lets out a sigh of relief as he takes the storage device from Lee. He then puts on a show of pity.
I'm really impressed with your abilities, it's a real pity that you must die today.
Is this why you withheld information?

Lee's heart pounds in his chest as his body starts to grow cold. The wound he hastily treated had opened up while he was escaping, and he starts to feel faint and weak from the excess blood loss. He grits his teeth, trying to regulate his breathing.
You're quite sharp, I'll give you that, which is why I "trusted" that you would be able to crack that complicated security system even under those circumstances.
Oh, you hear that? Looks like their backup is here.
I'll leave the rest to you then, "teammate."
He retreats with a smile on his face and gun in hand. Lowering the gun, he aims at Lee's leg.
—Infection level decreasing, calibrating basic function modules.
...I'm going to put you down now. Please wait a moment while I heal you!
After a round of dissonance, Lee could faintly hear the calls of his teammates—Liv and Lucia's voices.
(My memory is all scrambled... Is it because of the infection?)
But he could not reply to the calls. The Punishing Virus messed up his visual module, eerie black and red squares keep changing in his view, exploding in his M.I.N.D. like twisted spirals.
Immense pain hacks away at his will as the Punishing Virus devours his thoughts. It tries to take over his mind and Lee gives it his all to try to remain conscious.

He uses his body to block Tifa's last strike and the Punishing Virus invades his frame through the wound. It is only thanks to the connection with Commandant's Mind Beacon that the infection level did not exceed the limit and is starting to decrease.
Liv had performed some emergency treatment on Lee and they are currently waiting for pick up in a safe corner of the subway station.
Lucia, who is usually calm and collected, is now fretting with worry. Lee has never seen her this anxious in all his time as a member of Gray Raven.

Liv grits her teeth as she continues to treat Lee's wound. Lee leans against Commandant as Commandant holds him close by his shoulders, supporting half of his weight. He may not be able to see Commandant's expression, but he could feel the hands on his shoulders slightly trembling.
Lee finds that he is not used to situations like this.
No need to worry, I will be fine. He wants to say "Don't worry," but he could not even find the breath to do so.
(My M.I.N.D. and the connection to frame control... is being blocked?)
(The infection levels have started to lower, I should be able to control my frame... This leaves one possibility.)
(...I need to find a way to inspect my M.I.N.D.)

To inspect the M.I.N.D., one needs to enter a comatose-like self-inspection mode. This means that there will be a period of time when he will have to cut off all sensations to the outside world. He would be powerless in the face of danger.
(How foolish would it be if it all ended here, but...)

In desperate times, the most efficient strategy is to abandon those who have lost their mobility and evacuate. If needed, those "members" can also be used as "bait"—that is one of the unspoken "rules" of Kurono.
Although the speed of evacuation is severely hindered and they have been surrounded by the Corrupted several times, Gray Raven does not entertain the thought of abandoning him for even one second.
—Entering self-inspection mode means he will have to cut ties with the outside world, but he has Gray Raven by his side now.
Each of us is an indispensable feather necessary for Gray Raven to soar undeterred by opposing forces.
None of them have once renounced their vows.
(I can't... make them worry like that any longer. At least now, there is something I can do.)
(Cutting off external sensations temporarily. Preparing for self-inspection.)
He has numerous experiences with almost fainting from injuries, but this is the first time he feels... safe.
What appears in front of him is not his M.I.N.D., but a realm of chaos.
A moment of data error... Is this caused by the Punishing Virus?
There's no time to waste here.
I'll have to inspect them one by one.
In the vast sea of his M.I.N.D., Lee sees a red crystal floating in the sky.
Looks like that's the source of the abnormalities...
This is... Tifa's data shard? To think this was planted in me all this time...
I need to get rid of this quickly.
The moment he touched the crystal, Lee is sucked into another eerie dimension.
